Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2012 10:46AM rava wrote: Mom24boys. I had long hair when I first got the diagnosis. I cut my hair short just a feew days after. For me it was a way of starting the, I have cancer and is going to have chemo conversation with people who are not that close :)) My hair started to fall out just before chemo nr 2. Before that i lost like you, 15-20 strands if i ran my fingers through it. I had my husband and kids buzz it off the day after chemo nr2.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2012 10:27AM rava wrote: Hello ladies. I'm a newbie here :) I'm 6 weeks PFC and my biggest concern nowadays is hair! it's like I just wanna sitt and watch myself in the mirror trying to see if the hair growes in ... Crazy .... I didn't loose it all, and it kept growing during chemo. I buzzed it of ceveral times. But I would expect there to be more hair now. i cant see any development in 3 weeks.it is like it is not growing at all... None of the eyebrows or lashes has returned :( Guess I just have to be patience :)) My father has alopeicia universalis and It suddenly struck me, what if having chemo is a trigger for me go develop the same condition.... Ooohhh, I just want my hair back....
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: rava wrote: This is my first post on this forum. I really hope it is one of my last... I`m a 38 year old woman from Norway. Have two daughters 11 and 6 years old. The 20 of september I found a lump in my rigth breast. I got an apointment with my doctor and she confirmed it. The national guide lines here in Norway says "wait and see" for young women with lumps in their breasts ... She first told me we should wait for up to 2 months with regular check ups on the lump. I must say I was very concerned. After two weeks I went back to my doctor. She then forund a lump under my right arm as well I got a mammogram, ultrasound and a biopsy. I was told that "this is not a innocent cyst". The lump is 3,5 cm on it`s longest and lies under the nipple and a little over to one side. It looked like a sausage, the radiologist said.. She also did an UL og the lump under my arm...She looked concerned, but could not give me an answer on weather it was malignant or not.... Tomorrow I`v got an appointment with a surgeon at the hospital... Have been waithing now for over a week to get the results.... Ooohlala, I`m soo excited feel sick... My husband will join me, I really hope I can sleep tonight... MX 11.8.11 no recon. Medullary carcinoma. Ki67 84% starting chemo 12.16.11 FEC 100 x 4 Taxotere x 4. 17 cycles of Herceptin. 25 rads. Diep reconstruction 09.15.13 Dx 10/26/2011, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 7/13 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: The long wait.... rava SarahsMom

Posts.Content: Oct 26, 2011 05:48AM rava wrote: Thank you all for your thoughts The "wait and see"  guidelines are for young women wich don`t have a high risk of getting breast cancer ( no breast cancer in family, no smokers, normal weight, combined with age)   My appointment tomorrrow is at 1200 o`clock..... I think I will bring penn and paper as well...
Posts.Title: The long wait.... rava SarahsMom

Posts.Content: Oct 27, 2011 12:34AM - edited Oct 27, 2011 12:35AM by rava Just got home from hospital. I`v got breast cancer.... I spoke to the surgeon who is going to operate on me. She told me it was most likly a meddulary carsinoma wich she said was a rear type of tumor... They also found cancer cells in the node they tested. I really hope this node has done it`s jobb. The node was 2,5 cm... Phu!! I will be operated 8 november on our local hospital.  The surgeon recomended to do a masectomy... Now I will fight this sh**, and make sure it leaves for good!!
Posts.Title: The long wait.... rava SarahsMom
